page.title: 01GAZETEER
page.content: The D- block which we chose as our survey area is situated in the heart of the Leicestershire Countryside. It lies about 7 miles to the North East of Leicester. This rural area, consisting mainly of grazing for cattle and various forms of arable farming, is dotted with small villages. These are called South Croxton, Barsby and Ashby Folville. These villages were histonically thriving farming communities with local amenities such as butchers and bakers, and were inhabited with people who worked in the village or on the local farmland. Barsby for instance, was a prospening cheese producing village. Since local employment and amenities have declined and most residents in the villages are either retired or commute to work in Leicester or Melton.
